comments.text: Mkokk
comments.author: Lionel Pallares

comments.text:
+Marot Yoann Pour mettre fin aux polémiques inutiles, voici le communiqué 
officiel de Moto Journal, publié sur sa page Facebook le 5 février 2014 :
"Laurent Cochet a décidé de poursuivre sa route vers de nouveaux horizons. 
Après 23 années passionnées passées à ses côtés, Moto Journal lui souhaite 
bonne chance dans sa nouvelle vie."
comments.author: Bertrand THIEBAULT

comments.text:
A bon car il était bon. Mais ça me fais bien plaisir de voir moto journal 
et ses post, mais j'ai l'impression que les commentateurs s'en inspire bcp 
et du coup ça me fais penser à lui. Je suis content de voir qu'il a laissé 
un peu de sa bonne vibs à moto-journal. >Big up à Lolo et à moto-journal!
comments.author: Marot “ElémenTerre” Yoann

comments.text:
+geronimo020280 pas de soucis, c'est vrai que le départ de Lolo date mais 
l'annonce officiel a été faite il y a moins d'un mois
comments.author: Marco Ruegg

comments.text:
+Marco Ruegg Oups, j'ai pas Facebook, avis trop précipité de ma part lol, 
mais bon ça date un peu quand même
comments.author: geronimo020280

comments.text:
+geronimo020280 Faut un peu mieux se renseigner, ils ont annoncés son 
retrait de chez MJ sur leur page FB.
comments.author: Marco Ruegg

comments.text:
+Marot Yoann Ca fait des mois qu'on leur demande, ils ne répondront jamais, 
sinon, ils l'auraient fait depuis longtemps.
comments.author: geronimo020280

comments.text: Yeah, sinon; que deviens Mr Lolo?
comments.author: Marot “ElémenTerre” Yoann

top_comment.text:
:-o quoii !!! Mais.....mais pourquoi serge eunuques (mon pilote préfère) à 
fait le con ? Pk il a pris des anciennes moto en sachant qu'il n'avait 
aucune chance, il aurait pu gagner peut-être ﻿
top_comment.author: andrei5251

comments.text: Autant pour moi alors ! :)
comments.author: MrSam_

comments.text:
+MrSam_
 ce com n'était pas contre le tien
comments.author: I'm WolanD

comments.text: +I'm WolanD Justement, je dis que c'est une bonne chose !
comments.author: MrSam_

comments.text: qu'il se marre un peu ça te gène?
comments.author: I'm WolanD

comments.text:
+andrei5251 Oui mais on en revient au même point : Dans tous les cas, il 
n'aurait pas gagné et du coup la vidéo aurait été moins marrant, moins 
"dingue" :)
comments.author: MrSam_

comments.text: Ou parce-que il savait qu'il n'avait plus de chance de gagner...
comments.author: andrei5251

comments.text:
Peut-être parce que si il avait pris une moto "récente" ça aurait été moins 
marrant..
comments.author: MrSam_

comments.text:
La gniake, le style, le Groland dans toute sa splendeur, il ne faut pas 
chercher plus loin !
comments.author: Aimedé, the Captain formerly Static

top_comment.text:
Caras, adooooooooooooro suas reportagens!!!! São sempre muito legais!! 
Parabéns, e obrigada pelos bons momentos que vocês me proporcionam. Un jour 
je veux y aller en France que pour vous connaître! Je suis fous de vous!!! 
Admirable SERGE!!! Bises, Ana - São Paulo - Brésil. ﻿
top_comment.author: Ana Pereira

comments.text:
merci pour l'attention mais moi je préfère vraiment en français! bisous du 
Brésil
comments.author: Ana Pereira

comments.text:
+Ana Pereira 

For our foreign fans, you can also go on our new English channel named 
"Motorcycle Videos by Moto Journal". Thanks to share it ;-)
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4qmra3vNzPdpoC-LNQ7oLw
comments.author: Moto Journal

comments.text:
+Double Decker Fridgeman Seriously, it's so difficult to translate humor in 
a foreign language. We are not so fully bilingual to do it well, sorry. Try 
the Google audio translation service, but I'm not really sure the result 
will be nice, unfortunately !
comments.author: Bertrand THIEBAULT

comments.text: +Bertrand THIEBAULT I had enough french in school thank you very much
comments.author: Double Decker Fridgeman

comments.text:
+Double Decker Fridgeman Right, nothing is impossible. By the way, it's not 
impossible to learn french. Just try it  ;-)
comments.author: Bertrand THIEBAULT

comments.text:
+Bertrand THIEBAULT Nobody got time for that. Also im pretty sure its not 
impossible to translate
comments.author: Double Decker Fridgeman

comments.text: Impossible to translate ! Learn french and have fun !
comments.author: Bertrand THIEBAULT

captions.text: The Scorpion Masters is the cream of the crop in bikes
The meeting of Dirt and asphalt
Where the two-wheels elite meets
Yeah I think I’m gonna win the Scorpion Masters
Taking account of the bonuses you can order me
a Lamborghini or a Maserati I don’t know yet
World Champions here ? We find tons of them
From Trial, Enduro, cross, supermoto,
to endurance and speed
And even some steering wheel sorcerers
like Sebastien Loeb nine times rally world champion
All this to crown the best of the bests
the king of the handlebar
Sent at great expense by the Groland présipauté
The knight Serges Nuques is the last edition’s winner
But the doctors are formal:
The Knight’s intern clock is completely broken
In Groland time, which does not run at night for economic purposes
Sergei has come to the Paul Ricard track a good quarter century late
In his cart: Bikes from an old age
Just enough to beat his challengers down
with these 2stroke Yamahas
smelling good of ricine oil
The 125 TY, a model from 78’
with a 175cc kit it’s a true thoroughbred
The 125 DTMX is the ultimate weapon for Enduro specials
A 14hp trail that kids have been dreaming of in the 80’s
With its cantilever shock
To defy supermoto specialists: here is the 490WR
A 92’ model with its 17 inches wheels
large brake and its 50 wild horse power…
or maybe not
At last, for speed, here’s the famous OW31
This one is a customer competition 750 two stroke
A machine able to fight with the GP stars at the time
A beast
The most important on this kind of races
Is preparation
Did it just came ?
Yeah, so there’s one start assured already
To have the good bikes of course
but also the good combustible
Victory is a fight that starts even before the race
Take care of the details is a need
a top equipment, a known sponsor
All that can weaken the mood of the opponents
speaking of which, there’s hard thinking in the air
They’re insane you know why is there no rally special ?
psychological war has started
Tv channels from all over the world are already
staring at the best of them
Ok now it’s done for the training let’s get started !
even though some are already on the ground
before the trial start
Isn’t it Mr Bouan ?
Oh crap you’re here recording and all you bastard
Just to foul with the others
the organization make the best one start first
And it seems over easy with Alexendre Ferrere
Junior trial world champion
But straight after it’s already more laborious
Special thanks to Moto Journal’s chief editor
with an artistic mark of 9.96/10
Here is someone here to make it a fest !
Thankfully we can count on the Groland Knight
to increase both the level and the good mood
Race pilot, race machine with this TY125
Champion’s preparations
This is the Grolandais Nouveau ! Good huh ?
Yeah yeah very good
We quickly recognize the great men
If needed, rest on the technical support
a cutting-edge team
It’s not a ninefold car rally world champion
that will impress the Groland’s man
Michel ? no he does not answer it’s not him
I’d like to see Michel, this one seems renowned
but I don’t know who he is
Ok swinging at 2km/h between rocks is nice
but to be a true champion there’s a time
you need to full throttle
And now we launch the cavalery for the enduro
Well cart horse for Sergei and his 1981 DTMX 125
With no control, power is nothing it is said
and without power, talent is everything
Obviously, against the world enduro stars
and their factory machines
Sergei is ranking down a bit
Are you that guy I overtook ?
Yes it seems so… sorry
next time you get out !
fuck !
20th of the round but everything is still possible
So en route for the tar
In supermoto it’s another story
a matter of specialists in drifting
But then again Sergei has the ultimate weapon
with his Yam 490WR supermotoïsed
but mainly his dream team
because an antic two stroke on the brink of a breakage
need to be pampered a lot
What matters is to believe in yourself
We have planned a refueling at the sixth lap
it should be okay
And with the number one tag and a superhero cloak
Win is guaranteed
Yes our knight with superpower knows how to fly
Style wise, nothing to say
Sergei even overtakes some soft boiled guys
with its machine from the past century
Without having his cloak stuck in the wheels
It’s rather engine wise that the problem is
The two stroke breaks sometimes
and after it’s good to nothing
The Groland team thought about taking the DTMX as their supermoto
Everything is fine ! We won’t stop anyway
but we’re out of gas !
don’t worry about this I put red wine
With the support of the smelly two strokes god
and these losers
The WR is back again
And while the battle is obviously severe at the front
its scrapping metal at the back too
Sergei’s trick is to sedate his opponents
with his oil vapors
look, there’s nearly nobody behind him
Ok the result isn’t glorious but we can keep hoping
To get back, only the two speed races are left
On the true Ricard, the 3.8, the man’s track
Here the Red Wine team uses all the technology available
A factory bike, brand new data acquisition
We settled it for a dry race
And the first-order technical team as always
The best of the pit-lane in short
That’s what it takes to bring this antiquity back to life
The OW31 of Gilles Husson, a beast of 90hp
But even with superpowers the race is uneven
impossible to draft with Vincent Philippe’s endurance GSXR
or even the simple 600 CBR of David Knight
It sucks to grow old
As for the Red Wine engineers that couldn’t find
wet settings
nor the traction mapping to counter the monster kicks
With sadness and the tail between his legs
The knight had to go back to the pits after a mechanical incident
therefor giving up on victory hopes
Show me the damn engine mapping !
I put the dry one because he’s a pilot
a champion
We put four but the machine got drowned
So I ended up with the DTMX mapping
That's right
so the power…
Not easy to live in another time
but clap-o-meter wise, he is the champion
Our Knight
So get your shit together
For we are no sticks
and BANZAI !

title: Un chevalier égaré au Scorpion Masters (English Subtitles)
